title: Send email when added to team
body_html:
This addresses the first item on #144 (Send an email when added to a team).

A few notes on what I have done:

  1. I have monkey patched Mail::Message to respond to :deliver_later in config/initializers/monkey_patch_mail.rb. I've done this to make upgrading to Rails 4.2 easier when we have ActiveJob available. It essentially puts the mailer in a background job. This should be removed when upgrading to 4.2 .
  2. I've added the foreman gem. It is nicer and easier to have your environment variables in a .env file. I've also added .env to the .gitignore file. I can update the readme to reflect this in the Mailtrap section.
  3. I had a bit of trouble with other tests failing because they were trying to deliver the email. I've set action_mailer.raise_delivery_errors to false. Let me know if this is unacceptable, and I'll find another way.

Bed time!

body:
This addresses the first item on https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/issues/144 (Send an email when added to a team).

A few notes on what I have done:
1. I have monkey patched Mail::Message to respond to `:deliver_later` in `config/initializers/monkey_patch_mail.rb`. I've done this to make upgrading to Rails 4.2 easier when we have ActiveJob available. It essentially puts the mailer in a background job. This should be removed when upgrading to 4.2 .
2. I've added the [foreman gem](https://github.com/ddollar/foreman). It is nicer and easier to have your environment variables in a `.env` file. I've also added `.env` to the .gitignore file. I can update the readme to reflect this in the Mailtrap section.
3. I had a bit of trouble with other tests failing because they were trying to deliver the email. I've set `action_mailer.raise_delivery_errors` to `false`. Let me know if this is unacceptable, and I'll find another way.

![Wiggle](http://i.imgur.com/4nQacF3.gif)

Bed time!
